Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate the difference between a plant that has enough water and a plant that does not have enough water.
The student can draw the effects of water on plants, showing how a plant looks when it has water and when it does not.
The student can include evidence that plants need water to live and grow in their drawing, such as showing healthy versus wilting plants.
The student can identify and represent patterns in their drawings to show how lack of water impacts plant growth.
